Day0:
Day 1: Chest and Triceps 
1. Warm-up (10 minutes) - Jogging in place, jumping jacks, or jumping rope 
2. Barbell bench press (4 sets of 10 reps) - 30 minutes, burns 200-300 calories 
3. Incline dumbbell press (4 sets of 10 reps) - 30 minutes, burns 200-250 calories 
4. Dumbbell flyes (4 sets of 10 reps) - 20 minutes, burns 100-150 calories 
5. Triceps dips (3 sets of 10 reps) - 15 minutes, burns 100-150 calories  
Total time: 105 minutes, burns 700-850 calories
Day1:
Day 2: Back and Biceps 
1. Warm-up (10 minutes) - Jogging in place, jumping jacks, or jumping rope 
2. Pull-ups (3 sets of 10 reps) - 30 minutes, burns 200-300 calories 
3. Bent-over barbell rows (4 sets of 10 reps) - 30 minutes, burns 200-250 calories 
4. Seated cable rows (4 sets of 10 reps) - 20 minutes, burns 100-150 calories 
5. Barbell bicep curls (3 sets of 10 reps) - 15 minutes, burns 100-150 calories 
Total time: 105 minutes, burns 700-850 calories

Day5:
Day 6: Cardio 
1. Warm-up (10 minutes) - Jogging in place, jumping jacks, or jumping rope 
2. Treadmill running (30 minutes) - 30 minutes, burns 300-400 calories 
3. Elliptical machine (30 minutes) - 30 minutes, burns 300-400 calories 
4. Stationary bike (30 minutes) - 30 minutes, burns 250-350 calories 
5. Cool-down (10 minutes) - Stretching or yoga poses 
Total time: 110 minutes, burns 1200-1500 calories
Day7: The estimated time required for each activity may vary depending on individual fitness level and speed. The total estimated time for all activities each day is 105-110 minutes. The estimated number of calories burned may also vary depending on individual factors such as weight and intensity level. The total estimated calories burned for each day is 700-850 calories, except for the cardio day which burns 1200-1500 calories.
